alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 7:55PM MDT until April 24 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River near Redfield affecting Spink County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Redfield. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Moderate flooding of significant amounts of agricultural and wooded areas begins * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:16 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:16 PM CDT Saturday was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling to 15.6 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Sunday.
